title: Regression 1.67.0: Static archives have different unix permissions than before

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given this code:

```rust
#[no_mangle]
pub extern "C" fn foo() {}
```

I get this output from rustc:

```
$ rustc +1.66.1 foo.rs --crate-type staticlib && ls -alh libfoo.a
-rw-r--r-- 1 acrichto acrichto 22M Jan 30 16:28 libfoo.a
$ rustc +1.67.0 foo.rs --crate-type staticlib && ls -alh libfoo.a
-rw------- 1 acrichto acrichto 22M Jan 30 16:28 libfoo.a
```

The most recent archive no longer has the "read" permission bit set for group/world owners. This ended up breaking [Wasmtime's build](https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/actions/runs/4048924720/jobs/6964738137) because our files are built in a container with a different user and aren't then readable outside of the container. There's no particular reason we do this and we can work around this, but I also suspected that the change in permissions here probably wasn't intentional.

I think this is due to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/97485 (cc @bjorn3), specifically [this line](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/001a77fac33f6560ff361ff38f661ff5f1c6bf85/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/back/archive.rs#L279). I haven't dug too deeply but my guess is that temp files specifically turn off other permission bits
